title: Utah Water Conservation Analysis
description: A comprehensive data analysis and visualization project showcasing water conservation analytics for the Central Utah Water Conservancy District (CUWCD) 2024 Annual Report.
summary: This project demonstrates advanced data analysis skills through the examination of Utah's water resources, including snowpack trends, reservoir operations, water deliveries, conservation programs, and GPCD trends. The analysis provides actionable insights for water conservation companies and stakeholders.

key_insights.title: Strong Snowpack Performance
key_insights.description: Jordan River Basin at 134.9% and Lower Green River Basin at 131.2% of 30-year median, indicating excellent water supply conditions.

key_insights.title: Healthy Reservoir Levels
key_insights.description: All major reservoirs maintaining 88-93% average capacity, with peak levels reaching 100% during spring runoff.

key_insights.title: Effective Conservation Programs
key_insights.description: 609 turf removal participants converted 612,621 sq ft, with 1,493 smart controllers and 313 high-efficiency toilets installed.

key_insights.title: Measurable Progress
key_insights.description: Utah County achieved 8.7% GPCD reduction since 2018, demonstrating successful conservation education and implementation.

technical_implementation.title: Data Pipeline
technical_implementation.description: End-to-end analysis workflow from data collection through visualization, including data cleaning, feature engineering, and quality assurance processes.

technical_implementation.title: Statistical Analysis
technical_implementation.description: Advanced statistical methods including trend analysis, correlation studies, seasonal decomposition, and predictive modeling for water resource forecasting.

technical_implementation.title: Visualization Design
technical_implementation.description: Professional-grade static and interactive visualizations using Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly with custom styling and responsive design principles.

technical_implementation.title: Business Intelligence
technical_implementation.description: KPI development, executive reporting, and stakeholder communication through data-driven insights and actionable recommendations.

items.title: Performance Metrics
items.description: Quantifiable conservation results and ROI analysis

items.title: Stakeholder Communication
items.description: Clear data visualization and executive reporting

snowpack.title: Snowpack Trends Analysis
snowpack.description:
Key Insights

This comprehensive snowpack analysis reveals critical water supply information for Utah's water management:

  • Jordan River Basin: Peak SWE of 30.1 inches, averaging 134.9% of 30-year median
  • Lower Green River Basin: Peak SWE of 21.8 inches, averaging 131.2% of 30-year median
  • Seasonal Patterns: Clear peak snowpack in March-April with gradual melt through summer
  • Water Security: Both basins exceeded normal levels, indicating strong water supply conditions

The analysis demonstrates excellent snowpack performance in 2024, providing confidence in water availability for the growing season.

reservoir.title: Reservoir Operations Analysis
reservoir.description:
Operational Excellence

Reservoir management analysis shows effective water storage and distribution:

  • Strawberry Reservoir: 91.6% average capacity, reaching 100% during peak runoff
  • Jordanelle Reservoir: 92.6% average capacity with optimal storage efficiency
  • Utah Lake: 88.4% average capacity, maintaining healthy levels
  • Spill Management: Controlled releases during peak runoff periods

All reservoirs maintained healthy levels throughout 2024, demonstrating effective water resource management and system reliability.

deliveries.title: Water Delivery Patterns
deliveries.description:
Delivery System Performance

Water delivery analysis reveals efficient distribution patterns and customer service:

  • Total Annual Deliveries: 127,579 acre-feet across all customers
  • Peak Demand: June deliveries reached 17,854 AF (40% above average)
  • Top Customer: Jordan Valley Water Conservancy District (50,321 AF annually)
  • Customer Mix: Balanced municipal and wholesale customer base

The system demonstrates reliable water delivery with seasonal demand management and strong customer relationships.

conservation.title: Conservation Program Effectiveness
conservation.description:
Measurable Conservation Impact

Conservation programs show significant water savings and community engagement:

  • Total Participants: 2,510 individuals and organizations
  • Water Saved: 73.8 acre-feet through program participation
  • Area Converted: 709,298 square feet of turf removal and conversion
  • Program Mix: Turf removal (609), smart controllers (1,493), efficient toilets (313)

These programs demonstrate successful community engagement and measurable water conservation results, supporting long-term sustainability goals.

gpcd.title: GPCD Trends & Conservation Progress
gpcd.description:
Conservation Success Story

GPCD trends demonstrate successful conservation education and implementation:

  • Utah County Progress: 8.7% reduction from 210 to 192 GPCD (2018-2024)
  • Statewide Improvement: 11.4% reduction in average GPCD across all counties
  • Consistent Trend: Steady year-over-year improvement in water efficiency
  • Benchmark Performance: Utah County performing well below state average

The declining GPCD trends indicate successful conservation education, program implementation, and community engagement in water efficiency practices.
